alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 2:29AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sebastian and southeastern Le Flore Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 229 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Cameron to 4 miles southeast of Heavener to 5 miles southwest of Octavia. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Poteau... Greenwood... Heavener... Lavaca... Mansfield... Hackett... Hartford... Huntington... Midland... Cameron... Octavia... Big Cedar... Excelsior... Bloomer... Burnville... Jenny Lind... Rock Island... Patterson... Arkola... Crossroads... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
